name: AzureMysqlDeployment
description: This is an early preview. Deploy your changes to Azure Mysql database.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target Azure Resource Manager subscription for deploying MySQL files

inputs.name: ServerName
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure MySQL Server name, like Fabrikam.database.windows.net,1433 or Fabrikam.database.windows.net.

inputs.name: DatabaseName
inputs.label: Database Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the Azure MySQL Database, where the files will be deployed.

inputs.name: SqlUsername
inputs.label: Server Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the Azure MySQL Server administrator login.

inputs.name: SqlPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Password for the Azure MySQL Server administrator.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release Definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark the variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: SqlFile
inputs.label: MySQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the MySQL script file on the automation agent or on a UNC path accessible to the automation agent like, \\\\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\FabrikamDB.sql. Predefined system variables like, $(agent.releaseDirectory) can also be used here.

inputs.name: SqlInline
inputs.label: Inline MySQL Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the MySQL script to execute on the Database selected above.

inputs.name: SqlAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Mysql2 Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Mysql arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure MYSQL Database like, --ssl --user.

inputs.name: InlineAdditionalArguments
inputs.label: Additional Mysql2 Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Mysql arguments that will be applied when executing the given SQL query on the Azure MYSQL Database like, --ssl --user

inputs.name: IpDetectionMethod
inputs.label: Specify Firewall Rules Using
inputs.helpMarkDown: For the task to run, the IP Address of the automation agent has to be added to the 'Allowed IP Addresses' in the Azure MySQL Server's Firewall. Select auto-detect to automatically add firewall exception for range of possible IP Address of automation agent or specify the range explicitly.

inputs.name: StartIpAddress
inputs.label: Start IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The starting IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.50.

inputs.name: EndIpAddress
inputs.label: End IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ending IP Address of the automation agent machine pool like 196.21.30.65.

inputs.name: DeleteFirewallRule
inputs.label: Delete Rule After Task Ends
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, then after the task ends, the IP Addresses specified here are deleted from the 'Allowed IP Addresses' list of the Azure MySQL Server's Firewall.
